events.message: Customer reported an auto accident involving their vehicle hitting a pole due to slippery road conditions.
The reported claim was categorized under Auto Accident after verifying initial details from the customer.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to help guide the customer through the claim process efficiently.
Customer received an acknowledgment that their auto accident claim is now officially under review.
Documents such as accident photos, police report, and vehicle registration were requested from the claimant.
The claimant successfully submitted all requested documents including photos and official police accident report.
Investigation team began reviewing the case and verifying the validity of the claim based on submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded confirming the accident details and confirming fault of the other party involved.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer reflecting the estimated damages and policy coverage.
The customer provided positive feedback regarding the timely communication and fairness of the proposed settlement.
The claim was approved based on thorough review and all criteria being satisfactorily met.
Payment was successfully issued to the claimant to cover repair costs for the damaged vehicle parts.
The claim was officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation from the customer of repair arrangements.
All case documents and communications were archived for future reference and record keeping purposes.
